attributes.action: Give votes urgently to the 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum
attributes.background: The political scene is fragile and unstable because of the Government’s small majority with most MPs opposed to Brexit.  Urgently enfranchise the some 5½ million excluded from the Brexit referendum (46½ million electors) so that future elections and referendums are more properly representative
attributes.additional_details:
The 5½ million are
a) 1.5 million 16- and 17-year olds in the UK (as could vote in the Scottish referendum)
b) 2.0 million British Citizens living abroad disqualified by the 15-year rule or because never on a UK electoral roll (as in the Conservatives’ as-yet unkept “Votes for Life” manifesto promise)
c) 2.2 million unenfranchised foreigners living permanently in the UK (as would be electors if in New Zealand)

Numbers are derived from 2014-15 ONS and UN data. For details visit bit.ly/2cn7hrO

attributes.action: Stop the child tax credit cuts for a third child born from 6th April 2017.
attributes.background: This policy would lead to child poverty and charities are concerned that this would result in poverty and generations of lower classes whereby this right is only for the privileged. Those who said we are all in it together can not implement this policy. Thereby we urge the government to review this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/The%20Childrens%20Society%20-%20two%20child%20limit%20supplementary%20evidence.docx

http://www.barnardos.org.uk/poverty_full_report_07.pdf

attributes.action: We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint.
attributes.background:
We want the government to set clear National guidance on the use of restraint on children and young people in schools and care facilities.
All special schools, residential facilities and mainstream schools (that use restraint) must also have sound recording CCTV were restraint is used.
attributes.additional_details: Children/young people with disabilities are being restrained and injured, my son has been both physically and mentally damaged through restraint and the Government must set clear guidance and standards to safeguard our children/young people.

attributes.action: Force UK Cell Network operators to provided Cell Networks fit for rural business
attributes.background:
When in rural areas it is often impossible to make mobile phone calls and when possible the reliability of the signal is very poor, this includes both Voice and Data signals.
Agricultural businesses use mobile signals for different reasons, these system are often unreliable due to poor networks
attributes.additional_details:
Use mobile devises for voice or data in French rural areas then repeat this in the UK, there is a major difference in performance, the UK offering a system which is often poor in quality, unpredictable & not fit for purpose.
The difference appears to be the fact that the French system roams between providers while the UK doesn't allow UK devises to roam.
Poor quality UK Networks costs rural business and needs to be improved urgently. Rural UK business need a system fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Not just blindly leave the EU but instead establish a Royal Commission
attributes.background: The referendum was enacted so that a simple majority would be sufficient to establish a decision. For deciding the future of a union refined over 43 years, this would not make sense unless the result was advisory. Since the majority was 52% over 48%, the result should not be followed blindly.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition, there is evidence to suggest that many people used their vote not for its intended purpose but to register a protest with the government.

Also, in law the referendum result is not legally binding upon the government; it is merely advisory.

As such, the result should not be followed blindly, with no intervening steps between the result and the government acting to leave the EU.

The Government should establish a Royal Commission, or other suitable body, to investigate.

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt.
attributes.background: The budget for mental health trusts fell by 2% from 2013/14 to 2014/15. Also, in the year April 2016 the budget for mental health trusts was projected to rise by a dismal 0.3%. Jeremy Hunt is ruining our NHS, which was created after WW2 to assist people regardless of their socioeconomic background.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned call upon parliament to hold a vote of no confidence in Rt Hon Jeremy Hunt. Arguably, Jeremy Hunt is in breach of The National Health Service Act (S1) (1a). It states 'The Secretary of State must continue the promotion in England of a comprehensive health service designed to secure improvement in the physical and mental health of the people of England'. By cutting the budget of mental health trusts Jeremy Hunt is, potentially putting patients lives at risk; not promoting the NHS.

attributes.action: Enact that The House of Lords become the People's House, elected by direct P R
attributes.background: The House of Lords is an unelected body of career appointees. It serves the people worse than did the Hereditary Peers, under the Bill of Rights and the Parliament Act of 1911 The Lords must effectively balance the Commons (which increasingly does not serve the People); a PR HoL will do so.

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative Dragracing track
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and could easily be reused as a motorsport venue.

attributes.action: Rules on assisted living need to be based on need not age
attributes.background: My father is heavily disabled and has been turned down by an assisted living organisation because he isn't 60, there are far more abled people within this home, this needs to be based on the need of the person not the age of the person. Assessment of the care required vs age restriction is a must

attributes.action: Encourage companies to provide home based jobs for the disabled/chronically ill.
attributes.background: I want more large UK companies to provide home based job roles so the disabled/chronically ill have more opportunities available to them. Many disabled/chronically ill people hate not being able to work and want to contribute, but find it hard to find a well paid job to suit their ability.
attributes.additional_details: I am a sufferer of Ulcerative Colitis, a chronic illness and form of Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I recently had to step down from my managerial role due to my illness. I  looked for a legitimate UK home based job without success. I was only able to find US based work at home jobs. I want this for the UK.

attributes.action: Make audio-visual announcements be included in the government's new 'Buses Bill'
attributes.background: If the government are reviewing the overall regulation of the industry then it would be a suitable time to ensure that bus networks are fully accessible. Audio-visual technology speaks and displays next and final stop information, assisting those visually impaired to use the bus with confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
I am petitioning as I would like to see the government's new bill include a requirement for ‘Talking Buses’. These are buses which include on board audio-visual (A/V) next stop and final destination announcements, as well as other important information regarding the service. This vital assistive technology enables people who are blind or visually impaired to get the bus independently and with confidence.

This technology is a rarity outside London, and that needs to change!

attributes.action: To apply CCTV in to the family courts.
attributes.background: To end the corruption in family courts, proceedings should be recorded. These recordings could be passed onto the police to enable them to investigate if allegations of lying under oath are made.
attributes.additional_details: By adding CCTV to prevent social workers, judges and parents from lying or turn them away from the idea of lying under oath.

attributes.action: Stop horses and cyclists using roads with higher than 30mph speed limits
attributes.background: As a car enthusiast who uses social media a lot and also having freinds with horses and a few who cycle I see a lot of posts arguing about safety on the roads. I think the simplest place to start is to keep both horses and cyclists in lower speed limit areas reducing the risk of accidents hopefully.

attributes.action: Urge the Governments in China, Vietnam & Asia to ban the Dog Meat Trade
attributes.background: I was physically sick when I saw a video on Facebook depicting the torturing to death of dogs for human consumption. The dogs are kept in horrific conditions & as sentient animals, feel the same emotions that we do. They are absolutely terrified. It is inhumane, barbaric & abhorrent & needs to stop
attributes.additional_details: The Yulin Dog Meat Festival & Asian Dog Meat Trade focuses on farming dogs for human consumption. Thousands of dogs are rammed into tiny cages, contorted & left to weaken. Dogs are happy animals & it is believed that their happiness & good health is passed onto those who eat them. The perpetrators think that torturing the dogs by blow torching & skinning them alive & battering their heads willl keep the meat tender. Videos & live Facebook appearances, notably by Ricky Gervais are ref points.

attributes.action: Make chronic stomach/bowel conditions eligible for a disabled person's railcard
attributes.background: Many people who suffer from chronic stomach/bowel illnesses such as inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome will opt to use trains for long distance journeys, due to their accessible toilets, on demand. Due to the need for accessible toilets, we ask that sufferers receive a discount.
attributes.additional_details: Toilets are a major necessity for people who suffer from stomach/bowel conditions as they can be urgently needed at any time during a journey. This can prevent people from driving long journeys as service stations can often be few and far between. We ask that the government add chronic stomach/bowel illnesses to the list of conditions eligible for a disabled persons railcard. In some cases, people will choose a train journey instead of long car journeys to avoid embarrassment, anxiety and pain.

attributes.action: Update Parliamentary procedures so that impeachment is reinstated as a sanction
attributes.background: During the referendum campaign, MPs Boris Johnson, Andrea Leadsom and others continually made the statement  that we, in the UK, ‘send the EU £350 million a week.’ This statement  is untrue. They included the UK rebate in this figure. However, the rebate never leaves these shores
attributes.additional_details: Despite being continually told that this statement was untrue, these MPs continued to repeat it. Impeachment was used as a method for holding MPs to account. However, it is claimed by some that it is 'obsolete' and cannot be used as a sanction. Without impeachment there appears to be no way of holding MPs and others to account for this type of behaviour. So let us call on Parliament to update and reinstate impeachment to deter other MPs from this type of egregious behaviour.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided.
attributes.background: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided and therefore they should not use roadways or footpaths adjacent.

attributes.action: Commit to close the funding gap in UK science research left by leaving the EU
attributes.background: The UK is a key player in international scientific research, accounting for nearly 16 percent of the most cited articles. The EU funded up to 17 percent of HEI grants, this deficit must now be met. Intellectual property is a vital british export, investment is of crucial importance to our economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Extra detail about how the EU helped UK science and they key issues that must be addressed:

http://scientistsforeu.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/SfEU_factsheet_12-2-2016.pdf

attributes.action: STOP fining parents & providing evidence of ill children who miss days of school
attributes.background: My child has missed many days of school due to Asthma. He has regular flare ups and suffers with coughing fits/ weasiness & breathlessness as a result also causing lack of sleep and the need to stay at home. We are facing a court proceedings because of his low school attendance percentage.
attributes.additional_details: We have had to provide /medical evidence' and letters of consent from a doctor to say he is unfit for school. This is discriminating against a parents' verbal word, making us feel like liars when our child is poorly. This takes up valuable doctors appointments, when our children are not always needed to be seen by a doctor. Other bugs fly around schools where we should also keep our children at home but not see a doctor. STOP PROSECUTING PARENTS for educational statistical targets!

attributes.action: Ensure plastic food packaging, plates and cutlery are environmentally friendly.
attributes.background:
France has passed a new law to ensure all plastic cups, cutlery and plates are compostable and made of biologically-sourced materials.
The UK should be making plans to implement similar plastics and packaging controls in order to tackle the growing problems of pollution and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish (World Economic Forum). Nearly a third of all plastics leak into the environment where they end up eaten by wildlife or in floating rubbish dumps in the sea.
The British government needs to take some kind of definitive action against the use of plastics in our country, if we’re going to have any chance of mitigating the problem of waste in a growing global population.

attributes.action: Investigate why there so many accidents on the M5 roadworks around Droitwich.
attributes.background: Since the roadworks were started between J6 and J4A and the lane restrictions were implemented, there have been almost daily incidents causing huge delays on this stretch of the M5. It's not as bad on similar motorway roadworks, so what's different about this stretch and what can be done about it?

attributes.action: Provide GCSE Physics and combined science students with a formula sheet in exams
attributes.background: From 2016 onward the changes to the GCSE specification means that students will have to recall a large number of equations, that were previously provided on formula sheet. We think this in unfair and is a test of recall and not a test of their scientific knowledge or understanding  .
attributes.additional_details:
As teachers we think this unfairly disadvantages students of a lower attainment level, students who first language is not English and students who have special educational needs relating to memory. 
We call on the government to require Ofqual to instruct the exam boards to change this and to provide students with a full formula sheet.

attributes.action: Change the name of the new GCSE's, as they are harder and worth more.
attributes.background: Recently GCSE's have been changed to make them more challenging for students. They have been made to prepare the students more for a levels, and we believe that this will be more challenging to get a good grade. The name 'GCSE' should be changed to something different.
attributes.additional_details:
Students now have to memorise there anthology (18 poems) in English.
Formulae have been removed from the Mathematics and Science GCSEs. So that must be memorised too.
Coursework has been replaced by full examinations. 
The content of the Mathematics GCSE has been expanded to cover A-Level topics.

attributes.action: Stop the delay in welcoming lone refugee children.
attributes.background: Save the Children originally asked for 3000 unaccompanied refugee children to be allowed into the UK. After an amendment, which changed this to an “unspecified” number of children, was added to the bill, it became part of the Immigration Act in May 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
It is stated that around one unaccompanied refugee child is accepted into the UK every 18 days. These children have a perilous journey and only some are lucky enough to make it to a camp. 

Many of these children are being used as sex slaves and even have their organs sold. 50% that were tested in Italy had sexually transmitted diseases. 

The purpose of this petition, is to demand the government act immediately to bring these children to the UK in far greater numbers than just TWENTY per YEAR!

attributes.action: Stop the super-rich avoiding tax: set a £40 million cap on money put into trusts
attributes.background: The super-rich can put limitless assets into trusts so that their beneficiaries pay only a fraction of the taxes they would otherwise owe.  We've seen this recently with the 7th Duke of Westminster, who will avoid paying £3.6 billion inheritance tax.  A £40 million cap would stop this.
attributes.additional_details: It's not illegal for the super-rich to put these assets into trusts but it deprives the Treasury of significant income.   The 7th Duke's unpaid contribution could have built 40 hospitals (at £90 million per hospital, including equipment and infrastructure) and would have represented almost 80% of the total inheritance tax paid to HMRC in 2015-16.  The £40 million cap is based on the BBC's figure (January 2015) that to join the super-rich you need to be worth $50-$100 million.

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to call a General Election after the referendum
attributes.background:
After the referendum the nation will have made a decision in relation to the direction with which to take the country. 

This is more important in the event of a vote leave result

Its only fair and democratic that the citizens of the UK are allowed to chose a government to lead through change

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: For Parliament to ban the non-stun slaughter of animals in the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has a proud and admirable record in animal welfare.  When the RSPCA's forebearer came into existence in 1824, it was the first such body of its kind.  It is shameful that almost two centuries later we still permit the inhumane slaughter of animals based on religious grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Both the RSPCA and the BVA are firmly of the view that animals who are not stunned before slaughter suffer.

The view of the previous Government was completely unsatisfactory and ignored widely accepted scientific evidence.  Additionally, the University of Bristol has released research indicating that many Islamic scholars agree stunned meat can remain Halal.

Regardless, it is time the United Kingdom joined Norway, Iceland, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Denmark, and Sweden in an outright ban.

attributes.action: Hold an Emergency General Election, to be held no later than February 20th 2017.
attributes.background: In order to restore public faith in the Democratic process, the public should be given the option to affirm its faith in the current government or to overturn it in a General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
Theresa May demanded the Same action when Gordon Brown took power in 2007.
The Fixed Term Parliament Act 2011 has provisions so that under certain circumstances a snap General Election may be held.
The Government has already Ignored numerous Petitions this year including the Largest Petition in British Political history.
The Leadership Crises that plagued almost all the Major Political Parties in Parliament should allow the British Public to have their say once again in a General Election.

attributes.action: Introduce personal safety & criminal action awareness training in schools in UK
attributes.background: We are teachers & self defence instructors that work with children of all ages and last year we surveyed a number of pupils in secondary schools in South Yorkshire. 6/10 freely admitted that they had a fear of violence from other pupils. 4/10 pupils freely admitted being attacked in the community.
attributes.additional_details: violent Crime figures are rising year by year and from 2015-2016 grow by 27%. Our survey showed that the fear of physical violence, harassment or abuse was making 2/10 children severely depressed and had a dramatic effect on the learner of others. The fear of peer pressure and threats of violence had a dramatic effect on Girls taking part Physical education. Only 2/10 children surveyed said they would know or be confident in what to do to protect themselves against aggression or violence,

attributes.action: Let merchants choose to trade using Imperial and/or Metric measurements.
attributes.background: EU law requires UK merchants to display weights and measures in metric units. Simultaneous display of Imperial units is allowed as an afterthought. Per Brexit, Parliament should enact a law allowing merchants to choose to display weights and measures in either Imperial or Metric units, or jointly.

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: Remove  Disabled Families/Parents/Children from the Troubled Families Policy
attributes.background:
We request that you fully support Disabled Families complete removal from this program.
Plus support a full public consultation to be launched to investigate. 
Why it was even deemed acceptable in the first place for Disabled Families inclusion in this policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Troubled Families Policy. 
As it stands the categories are: 
Parents and children involved in crime or anti-social behaviour 
Children who have not been attending school regularly 
Children who need help 
Adults out of work or at risk of financial exclusion and young people at risk of worklessness 
Families affected by domestic violence and abuse 
Parents and children with a range of health problems.

attributes.action: Urge India to end abuse Human Rights abuse and initiate a peaceful dialogue
attributes.background:
Recent use of pellet guns on Kashmiri protestors has caused blindness of more than 150 people mostly children and 60 deaths.
Kashmir is under curfew and serious restrictions imposed on normal daily life for 45 days.
Indian refuses to initiate a dialogue
attributes.additional_details:
1. Sir Henry Harding, Governor General on behalf of the British sold Kashmir in 1846 to the Maharaja of Punjab Gulab Singh for 7,500,000 Indian Rupees who then gave it away as a dowry to his son in law Maharaja Hari Singh!
2. British citizensof Kashmiri origin have relatives, near and dear one suffering from the atrocities
3. Kashmir issue is the main flash point between the two nuclear powers, India and Pakistan. Violence only breads violence and plays in the hands of foreign agencies.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays for special needs students
attributes.background:
Children that suffer from autism etc find summer holidays a distressing upheaval to their usual routine. This can cause them to violently lash out. 
These children struggle after six weeks and find it very hard to settle back into a routine at school which is distressing for all those around.
attributes.additional_details: I am a mother of an autistic child.  I see the effect even just a week half term has on my son, so how does the government expect him to cope with 6 whole weeks?!  I am not the one parent that feels the holidays are far too long for these children. The government have been saying for years they will cut the archaic 6 week holidays yet they haven't made any adjustment.

attributes.action: Move Trident from Scotland to Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: Scotland do not want Trident and the SNP have been fighting this vehemently . Meanwhile in Plymouth we have the capacity and would welcome the jobs with open arms

attributes.action: Save the NHS by creating a new law to commit 11% of U.K. GDP on Healthcare
attributes.background:
The NHS is in difficulties. With a growing ageing population we need a strong healthcare system. The U.K. Spends less as a proportion of GDP than many other neighbouring countries. 
Let's stop political parties using the NHS as a political tool. Let's all agree to spend 11% of  GDP  regardless.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-com

attributes.action: Make it easier to remove bullies from schools, at any age and fine the parents
attributes.background: As a parent, i find it outrageous that there is so much 'red tape' surrounding schools and exclusions. A child has to be excluded for a total of 45 DAYS before a permanent exclusion is warranted. Most of these exclusions are related to VERY SERIOUS incidents, but why wait for so many to take place?
attributes.additional_details: Parents whose children are victims of bullying are forced to remove their children from education for their safety, either to be home schooled or a change of school. Both of which can be extremely difficult for most. Why should victims have to change their friends, schools, routines and sometimes homes all because of bullies? It's time the bullies and their parents families faced the consequences of their childrens behaviour- not the other way round.

attributes.action: Make HCAs/phlebotomists belong to a professional registered body.
attributes.background: I am a healthcare assistant and a phlebotomist. I started off as a HCA over 4 years ago with no experience. I think that was dangerous. Especially with the care HCAs need to give. Would be nice for all the hard work we learn as we progress, and the care we give, that we belong to a recognised body.

attributes.action: Take Portugal's stances and decriminalize all drug possession.
attributes.background: The Portuguese government have decriminalised all illegal drugs. Drug addicts should not be treated like criminals and should be helped, not punished. Portugal has one of the lowest drug overdose rates in Europe whereas the UK has the highest.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_policy_of_Portugal

attributes.action: Allow 15 - 17 Year Olds to be able to Vote in a 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Since the Scottish Referendum in 2014 allowed voters as young as 16 to decide the future of their country, we believe that there should be a second referendum about Britain's EU membership, that allows voters as young as 15 to vote for our future.
attributes.additional_details: Many teenagers and young people were very well informed and very vocal about the EU referendum online, but in the end, were not given a chance to decide our own fate.

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.

attributes.action: Abolish unisex toilets in primary and secondary schools
attributes.background: In my child's school the toilets have become unisex. The school gave parents and children no notice prior to this happening. My child was shocked when a boy walked into the toilet. The girls in the school do not like it and some boys and girls have stopped using the toilet. This is a health concern.
attributes.additional_details:
These toilets are not like the ones we have at home with the sink, bin toilet in one room behind a closed door. There is a gap at the bottom and the top, there is no privacy. 

Both genders will be going through hormonal & bodily changes. Some girls start their menstrual cycle early. Will they not be embarrassed to use a shared toilet 

Both girls & boys have the right to explore their bodies in their own privacy amongst the same gender. The unisex toilets restrict this development which is sad.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Transition Government in Zimbabwe that includes ZANU PF ministers
attributes.background: ZANU PF and life President Robert Mugabe via a system of patronage over the last 36 years has systematically destroyed the economy of Zimbabwe & impoverished its people. At the same time elite Ministers and cronies have become wealthy beyond measure, by effectively looting Zimbabwe's resources.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government in it's secretive Foreign Office has unilaterally decided that a TRANSITIONAL GOVERNMENT will be put in place to avoid "REGIONAL CHAOS" [sic], WHICH WILL INCLUDE the "elite" referred to in the previously. 
ZANU PF Ex-Ministers/Civil Servants/Sponsors cannot in any form be linked to Government or control of Finances. 
They will simply use this money to rig the 2018 elections as they have clearly done in 2008 and 2013 by using DEADLY VIOLENCE and systematic VOTER FRAUD

attributes.action: Introduce Universal Basic Income (ie. a guaranteed income for all) to the UK
attributes.background:
What would you do differently with your life if your income was guaranteed, what positive choices would you make?

Universal Basic Income is a form of social security system in which all citizens or residents of a country regularly receive an unconditional sum of money.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal Basic Income is gathering momentum and there have been many positive tests across the world.

http://basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income/

Recent tests saw increased divorce rates as the freedom UBI brings allows women in abusive relationships to leave. People worked harder and donated their time to good causes.

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: Create special funding for the victims of racial hatred & bigotry postreferendum
attributes.background: After the brexit referendum was won, there has been a nasty upsurge in racial attacks & xenophobia in general.  We need to create special funding for the victims of this vile abuse, whether it be for counselling or repairs, whatever their needs. Also we need to ensure police resources to combat it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-devon-36737529
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075
https://secure.avaaz.org/en/petition/MPs_also_the_PM_David_Cameron_Provide_additional_funding_for_victims_of_hate_crimes/edit/

insurmountable evidence that there was was a latent problem & this referendum result has validated these bigot. So now we need to help drive it down into the cracks & crevices again.

attributes.action: Parliament to postpone the implementation of Article 50, for at least 6 months.
attributes.background: Further to the recent European Referendum, it now appears evident that the European Union acknowledges that changes must be made to better meet the current needs of member countries.  The UK should not leave the European Union until such time as the extent of any proposed changes are known.
attributes.additional_details: If those proposals still fall short of UK requirements for continued membership it will then be possible to negotiate exit arrangements with better knowledge of the future EU structure and conditions.

attributes.action: Amend Environment Protection Act to allow prompt rubbish removal on private land
attributes.background: Fly-tipping in many areas is getting out of hand. Often, rubbish is dumped in privately-owned alleys, garage areas, etc. Soon, the dumping is extended to adjacent pavements. The legal process for local authoritues to gain access, clear the land and recoup expenses is lengthy and costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the local authority embarks on the legal process, the problem escalates and more work is then required to keep on top of the rubbish now accruing in the public space.  The heaps of rubbish present health, fire and other safety risks in the meantime.

Local authorities should be allowed to issue a warning letter with a short notice period to remove the rubbish. Guidance and assistance should be provided to those landowners affected by persistent fly-tipping through no fault of there own.
